column11: Review Text
beach was amazing for me and my guest. we stayed there for 3 nights. the food was much better. there are many hotels around the beach
It is a well kept hotel with a pool in the center of center in a quiet spot. The manager and staff are very nice and helpful to fulfill all my needs. The rooms are nice and breakfast is good.

Totally sucks. Maybe it was the wrong time - it was lunchtime somewhere. We didn't see anyone. There are also a couple of dams there; if you swim up to them by mistake, they will be carried away by the current.

We went with Kayak Kingdom to the Bengalle lagoon and had a great time. The guide had good local knowledge with  bird life and solid kayaking skills. He was really friendly and  easy to talk to etc. We saw nesting herons, egrets, pelicans etc. A rare non- motorized wildlife experience in Sri Lanka.

Excellent early evening out Kayaking up the lagoon.Different birds than you will ever see in Europe,Glossy Ibis,Flamingos all flying over to roost for the night,this was about ,5.30 in the evening.Kingfishers and Oriental Divers which looks like a snake in the water. Water monitors and Monkeys in the trees surrounding us.Very special trip up the lagoon. This was all provided by our host Gayan at Coconut Island Cabanas.Nice cafe bar to relax in after the paddling.

We hired our Kayaks from Coconut Island Cabanas.Very good price and Gayan was helpful letting us know which way to go.The wildlife and birds were amazing.Herons,Flamingos,Divers and Kingfishers to name just a few.A well spent three ours.Just in time for a Passionfruit and soda fruit juice at Coconut Island whete we were staying.Very relaxing few hours.

peace heaven closed to the beach and the town, many birds, monkeys, varans, i raccomend to book a lagoon tour in Chandi Gaya Guesthouse or Clam's Restaurant becouse going in the canoes with a guide is much better to see all the animals that live here.
This is a very beautiful lagoon with lots of mangrow trees. There we could find canoes in to cheap rates. spend nearly 3 hours
If you are in Tangalle treat this place as an another nice activity to be done. You can hire  paddle boats at the entrance  to the lagoon

Best kayak tour had from tangalle Mahesh helpd us very much . He is a owner of this place . 0716789932 you can contact him via mention number.  Its fantastic tour . Lots of bird and little wild life tour . It was two hrs journey and superb . If you go to tangalle this is must

If you want to slow and be aware of nature, this is the right place. The best time is 1 hour before sunset. Clouds of birds, the frogs evening song. Everything helps you to stay in astonishment. You don't need to pay for a floater at the hotel. You can use a floater near the bank by yourself.

I was at tangalle and did kayak tour with them . What a best service given.  I was really money worth . Lots of bird and mogoos water buffalo and many more animal show . Thanks for given such best service

Excellent trip! Really beautiful scenery and saw lots of wildlife. Staff were very helpful  and friendly too. Definitely recommend this. Go early in the morning or in the late afternoon as you are out in the sun.
A paddle on this lagoon is a very interesting and relaxing way to spend an afternoon.  Some Hotels will hire our canoes and kayaks. Tranquil waters and not so deep.

Perfect way to relax and get away from the busy beachside's in Tangalle, especially in the morning time it's great... I went out at 6.30 (6 should be even better I think) and saw lot's of birds and a lot of water monitor lizards (some big ones) and to top it all off I saw an eagle (Brahminy Kite actually) swooping down and catch a fish couple of meters in front of me on my last 5 minutes... I was completely alone the whole time, very relaxing...When I was done at 9.45 I just saw two other kayaks entering the water. I enjoyed it so much I returned at 4pm to have another go at it... Lot's of birds returning, saw some monkeys in the trees (grey langurs) jumping over my head from tree to tree, and when it became more dark I also saw some bats... Downside at this time, bit more people out. Not that many though, saw like 9 others kayaks... If you decide to do this, make sure to inform at Mallika Guesthouse... Very friendly people and they only ask 750 lkr and tell you to take your time and enjoy, most others charge 1000 to 1500 lkr and some even say you have to pay extra if you exceed a 2 hour time limit (which I did with a big margin both times). Enjoy!
I been this place with my family. I wat mony worth .i saw lots of birds and water bafalow .mongoose and many animal . my kids was so happy .
Great location with stunning views of the beautiful lagoon ,great food, a warm welcome by their friendly staff,also has an interesting Herb garden .

Lovely lagoon with amazing mangroves and lots of bird life. We also saw a large monitor lizard and some monkeys. The noise from the nearby road was a little distracting but didn‚Äôt seem to bother the birds. Kayaks are well maintained and a map is provided so you can paddle around at your leisure. Lovely way to pass an hour in the late afternoon.  Early morning is also supposed to be a good time to see more bird life.
It‚Äôs changed since last time I was there because there was a storm so lagoon bit deeper now but worth floating around in the piecefull environment looking at the nature
2 hours kayaking on the wide lagoon. Perfect occasion to see wild birds and warans. Nice and relaxing time in the mangrove forest
Great morning paddling round the lagoon in a sit on canoe, birds, water monitors and fantastic mangroves.

This is one of the best things to do on the lagoon in Marakolliya,and you can rent the kayak or canoe from Coconut island cabanas.Better to go up stream of the road bridge as you can then canoe for hours if you choose.Remember a Sun hat or go later in the afternoon or early morning.

Went kayaking in Tangalle lagoon with my husband in the morning (7am start). It‚Äôs hard to rate this experience - on the one hand we saw so many animals (cormorants, darters, 4 kinds of heron, 2 kinds of bittern, water monitors- one of them tucking into a spot of bird for breakfast!), and some of them were just 2 meters away - a wonderful experience, especially in the mangrove tunnels at the start. On the other hand, the far end of the lagoon (which is where you‚Äôre told to go, as that is where the monitors are), is right next to the A2, with all the noise and especially the litter that that engenders. Especially the garbage is heartbreaking. Plastic bottles and bags can be seen everywhere in the far lagoon. We saw one heron that appeared to have its beak stuck shut with a plastic ring, that it probably picked up by accident. 5 stars for the animal encounters, 1 star for the trash situation.
Great scenery and untouched wilderness a great escape, the restaurant was amazing with fresh sea food. It was worth the trip and a must while in tangalle

Shame I don‚Äôt know too much about bird watching but was great at sunset. Went out on a little barge thing with a man and a pole. Cool box with some beers, very enjoyable sundowners and kids loved spotting the monkeys in the trees. Worth a trip if you are after a change from beaches.

If you getting bored of sand and sun! You schould check this out! Nice place for animals lovers a lot of birds mostly cranes but also varans! Don't forget to put your suncream ;) ! 1000 rupis for solo canoue.

I have never been to the Amazons, but I imagine it is a bit like this. It was a perfect short tour of 1,5 hours to go around the lagoon. We saw lots of birds and really enjoyed the silence and feeling close to nature.

We decided against going into the lagoon with the kayaking as it looked like a scrap what these wonderful little things go to die. There is some water buffalo, parrots and monkeys to see. Save your money and view these from the side and let them be.

We did the kayak think, but the water is so dirty, is so dark! If you watch too much horror movies, don't go, because I thought there were crocodiles or something horror animals! We only saw a few birds, that's all! So not worth it!

We walked from our hotel to the lagoon. About 1 km. At the lagoon we saw monkeys and a big water varan. We walked to the water when  someone from a hotel came to us asking us if we would want to rent 2 kayaks. We did for 2500 roepies. It was fantastic!!! A simple route and so quiet and beautiful. Great experience!
Really nice adventure, really hot though. We saw flying fish, monkeys and really exotic vegetation. Recomend a tour in the lagoon. Bring lots of water though.

We knew we wanted to kayak, but were thinking more ocean than lagoon, so we were pleasantly surprised when the tuk tuk drivers took us to the lagoon. What a surprise treat though! Our little guide that led the way through the lagoon was very helpful through the maze of trees. This was a late afternoon excursion for us and the guide said that early morning was best for the birds, but we still got quite an eyeful. We were a group of 12 with five children between us. Mine are 12, 10 & 6, and my sister's are 3 and 4. The 3yo can be quite squirmy, but he sat, enthralled.  We saw a few verge monitors making their way through the water, and quite a few monkeys as well. We also managed to catch sight of some local fishermen. Truly a wonderful experience for all.
It is a nice time..Can sea many different animals...So funny with Canon my self..... Please visit there...
It is better to go inside early in the morning or early evening to see some birds. Rent a canoe and row around, you can beautiful scenes  inside. Highly recommended.
The lagoon is really a peacefull place with a lot of birds. Walking around or going on a cano√´ is very pleasant.

I went early morning  it's full of wild life and birds even on the road beside lagoon  it was like a mirror saw lots of big water moneter lizard monkeys  lots of birds  saw snake  but on the walk to lagoon  you can just take your time and listen to the animals
The very best way to end the day in Tangalle. All the birds arriving back to the the trees and always a stunning sunset.
Sound osteopathy healing, with Sam your man. Great veggie food, and ayuvedic massages. Booked in for the afternoon and hope to be back for the yoga retreats.

If you have time in the afternoon you can expend some time there.  We expect to see crocodiles but we have not see any :( At least It's easy to book a trip, you just need to stop by at 4 pm and some of the guys there will provide you with a boat trip.

Tucked away in a bylane  that leads to the quiet beautiful beach is this shack. At 4 pm starved as we were, the friendly staff prepared fresh sandwiches and noodles for us which we devoured while sitting on the deck watching the beach and the sunset. Great atmosphere!

Got a tuk tuk from the town center, cost 300 rupees to a guy renting out canoes for 1000 rupees each. The lagoon is much bigger than we thought and we had a great time. Go early if you want to see the wildlife.
Good experience ,we payed 1000lkr per person. We saw few birds,monkie and varan -waterbandita. Water is brown.

We were taken out with a local fisherman to see the mangroves and the sunset over the lagoon. We payed 8000LKR for the tour normally lasting 2hrs but as we were keen to help with paddling we were out for about 1 hr. good experience, something out of the ordinary and good exercise.

Kayak with karu . Karau is middle age Person who belongs kayak . Nice men with smiling face üòÅ. You can call 0716789832 and book your kayak tour only 1500 Sri lanken rupees for two people . Birds . Lizard can be seen .
There are lots of birds to see here and it is a nice place to hire some kayaks at sunset. Good chance of seeing monitor lizards too!!
We rented guy with a boat and he took us across the lagoon. We saw many birds and big varanas. There is a nice mangrove forest.

It is really peaceful here . Better to come at the morning .. Tiny Canoe, Can't fit my muscular calf lol .. Nothing special for me much but I am enjoying and chilling here . Good for bird lover. Average price is 1000 rupees for 2 hours but a local  told me .. If you go with local friend , maybe get cheaper price.

Such a relaxing way to get off the beach for a bit. I went on a trip on a local catamaran for a sun downer. Loads of birds on every tree and at one point a water monitor hitch a ride with us on the outriggers balance. I'm sure an early morning trip would have been just as good, but who gets up early on holiday. Take a few beers and float around listening to nature and enjoy the spectacular show of colors as the sun goes down. I arranged the trip through a local tuk tuk driver. I even tried my hand at paddling (round in circles). Tangalle is more than just nice beaches.
Awesome fun.  We rented a double canoe from our hotel on the river and had a lovely day going down the lagoon.  We saw some lovely wildlife including big monitor lizards.  Definitely worth a visit!
We rented 3 canoes with a guide for a one hour trip on the lagoon. It is very quiet, early morning; easy to do, lots of animals and birds

We took out a two seater canoe which was free of charge from our hotel, Buckingham Place, onto Tangalle Lagoon. The water was pretty calm (in comparison to the local waves!). Whilst out on the water we were delighted to be surrounded by flying fish and were graced by the presence of an Eagle who was hunting fish while we paddled about. The Eagle hovered above us for what seemed like forever and then followed our path as the fish jumped beside us due to our disturbing the water. After a moment or two the Eagle swooped down and successfully caught a fish before flying back towards its nest or perching place in the nearby trees. We couldn't believe our luck to witness this happening within 30 feet of where we floated. A thoroughly enjoyable experience, even if you don't get that particular experience. The birds and fish living their lives makes it a very peaceful and relaxing activity.
Enjoy one of the best areas of bird watching in a quiet lagoon far from any urban disturbance. Recommended for late afternoon visits and admire the sunset.

beautiful and peaceful  lagoon, i used to work in tangalle for 6 months, this lagoon was my getaway from all the busyness. just hire a kayak and enjoy the beautiful nature and wildlife! don't forget to make a chat with the local fisherman ;)

We launched kayaks from the banks of the lagoon at our resort. It was very peaceful with no boats or other people on the water. we did it a couple of times checking out the local fish traps and abundant wild life a great and relaxing experience. It wasn't until we left Sri Lanka that we were told there are actually crododiles in the lagoon.
We sailed around the lagoon for a couple of hours and saw many beautiful birds. It was really peaceful and quite enjoyable.
Really nice place to come for sunrise to take some nice pictures or just bird watching, but make sure you have a flashlight with you if you go around after the dark.
We saw this lagoon from our hotel. Partially there was no water in it, therefore it stink which was unplesant. Otherwise it looks nice.
Lovely place to start the day, with a kayak that allows you to view the fishermen at work and the mangroves around the lagoon.

Just about 5 - 10 minutes drive off the roads of Tangalle town lies the Madilla lagoon area with many small guest houses, restaurants and the beautiful lagoon of tangalle, if you love bird life you can either visit the area early and rent out a boat or In the evening you can visit this place. nice, calm, relaxing with water and greenery.

Got here about 9am and had a few hours exploring the lagoon. Best time to go is earlier in the morning or 5.30pm when there is more wildlife. Saying that we still managed to see some huge lizards and a few birds. Really relaxing and the guy we rented the kayak through provided a map and dry bag for our stuff, letting us use the kayak for as long as we wanted.
We have stayed near the lagoon and we enjoyed exploring it by kayaks on a cloudy day. We have seen many lizards, some quite big, and many birds.

If you want to escape from the rush Tangalle this is maybe the best option. Lagoon is quiet and calm place - full of life - monkeys, varans and lots of birds including pelicans, cormorans etc. I recommend it. You can rent a boat for around 1000 rupies for whole day.
Kayaking around the lagoon is a very peaceful experience.  The array of birds and water monitors slipping into the water or sleeping on the trees are fascinating.

Lots of people on arrival but there are many boats so the queues went down quickly. The scenery is fantastic and the bird life is extensive, we saw water monitors in the Mangrove tunnels and a visit to the Monastery in the lake is a must. Great time letting the fish chew your feet, funny / fantastic feeling, not for the squeamish!!! beware the bridges, DUCK, they are that low.

We were not super happy about this place. The lagoon is basically a dirty canal, the grounds are full of rubble and the breakfast very disappointing (we also had a problem with the safe that would not open). For this very overpriced place one should be able to expect more. However, thumbs up to the manager who valiantly let us leave after one night without wanting money for the duration of the originally planned three nights.
So hard to find but when you do it's amazing. So peaceful and relaxing. saw a massive lizard thing and lots of birds. Very nice for a spare sunny afternoon :)
Very nice trip on a canoe, good for birds watching,  relaxing and enjoying the sunset especially . in mangroves possible to sea monkeys

lovely few hours kayaking around the mangroves, even in a thunderstorm! made friends with a local fisherman and got invited to come and sit out the rain in his hut on stilts in the lake! very friendly!

A kayak around the lagoon (2 people, 2000Rs) was a fantastic experience. It was so quiet and peaceful and it was fantastic seeing the bird (and snake!!) wildlife. It's easy to pick up too... Even though we managed to paddle directly into the bank at first!  The equipment is good quality. I was surprised that there were not more people talking advantage of this excellent activity...Maybe better advertising is needed!
Me and wife had a great afternoon in this lagoon, see wild monkeys in the trees and lots of bird life.
Tangalle lagoon is a rubbish strewn lagoon which needs a good clean up. I wouldnt recommend a visit. Try Matara or Galle.

A very beautiful lagoon, calm and beautiful. There are a lot of birds, lizards and even monkeys - you can see it if you are silent enough. We were so much impressed that did kayak in this lagoon twice.
Had a lovely afternoon kayaking on the lagoon, saw loads of monitor lizards and birds (no monkey's though).

I have been in the lagoon few times in fact i come here once a year since 2012 This lagoon is quite a big one and it is really interesting to explore. there are few entry pints to explore the lagoon, and i prefer the one on the road to "Medilla" beach. I actually go there for 2 reasons 1 Kayaking 2 watch birds and other animals live around this lagoon I recommend that everyone should explore this lagoon at least once by a boat or a kayak

For 2000 rupees we got 5 of us into a catamaran infested with red ants (killing them occupied is quite a bit) and almost sinking into the murky water. That aside the lagoon was peaceful and could see lots of birds and wildlife (iguanas mainly) as well as a pretty cool scenery. But overall I found the trip uncomfortable and there was no place to store valuables which we thought there would be, so we had to take them onboard and hoped for the best

Nice lagoon. Quiet and beautiful nature. You might see some veranas or the like and some local birds here. I only passed by on a walk on the beach road, but you can also hire kajaks and go rowing on the lake.

We hired a two man kayak for 1000 rupees for about two hours. We managed to see the entirety in about an hour as it isn't very big but you could spend more time. The lagoon was really beautiful and there were many birds to see. Unfortunately didn't see many other animals but was a great afternoon

We hired a kayak for 1000 rupees, they gave us a map of the route to take which also said what animals to look out for. It took us about 1-1 1/2 hours to go around, but could spend alot more time out there. We late morning and didnt see much except for alot of birds. Probably best to go early morning or late afternoon

We hired kayaks and went early and there was only one other person on the lagoon. Go slowly and you wIll be rewarded with many bird sightings. There was a dead buffalo in the water and the monitor lizards were having a feast on it so that made quite a spectacle. There were so many of them and they were huge. Can be quite scary! Lovely tranquill spot that you can have all to yourself!
Beautiful lagoon, visit it if you will rest in Tangalle. It is quiet and peaceful. Just a little bit dirty.
Very scenic, calm & beautiful country side & beaches. However, waves can be rough... Watch out for snakes in the lagoon water. Good kayaking or Canoeing.

We did kayaking 3 times for a few hours and it was fun. We saw a lot of varanus, monkeys and different birds. It seemed that early in the morning we saw more varanus than in the evening. Our hotel provided us with kayaks for free, but the best price we saw was 500 rupees for 1 single kayak  for 1 day at Lagoon Paradise Hotel.

If you go as a group, the organizer speaks English, so keep your boats close together, bring binoculars. The boats are platforms on pontoons, quite stable, but not suitable for busy children. A nice way to spend a lazy afternoon. Its quite a ways in from the main road, we used a van and driver for our party, no road signs along the many interlaced laneways so expect your driver to ask directions :-)

Didn't really like this place after the beach on THE FORTRESS HOTEL; this seems very placid. Recommend definitely to visit the beach before this one and experience both to understand the difference. But all in all everything is beautiful in sri lanka
Lots of beaches around- very picturesque and peaceful place. The natural swimming area formed by the lagoon is a lot of fun.
Sadly, went at the wrong time and saw very little wild life but a relaxing boat trip and cheap. I think you need to go early morning to really enjoy it.

This peaceful little magrove swamp can be explored by either canoe or organized trip.  A local escorted trip costs Rs 1000 per person and takes around two hours. In my view this trip was not worth the money. However, at Rs1000 per double canoe one may explore the area at leisure and get the benefit of being able to go as you please and follow the wildlife at will. Having tried both options I wold recommend the canoe as the better way to see the lagoon.
Very beautiful and picturesque location.  Plenty of birds and seeing the water monitors was a real treat.  Very near the beach too, so a good contrast.  Well worth a visit.
Well worth a sunset boat ride. Outstanding bird life. There are not many people that will take you but if you stay on the beach then someone will be able to arrange a trip.
Mosquito city. Cant be tranquil when you are being eaten alive. That's  all water, mosquitos, some kingfishers

Would definitely recommend doing this as it is so peaceful and lovely kayaking through the mangroves! Take reference points as you go along as there are some dead ends and it can be a bit confusing! Lots off bird life and monitor lizards about as well as monkieys. The map we were given wasn't at all helpful, and do bargain with the initial price given :-)
In plastic canoe - floating past vast array bird including Sea Eagle - lizards , snakes, fish. Amazing,swamp smells, sweating, water in boat but totally magical. Wear plaenty of Anti Insect lotion.

Mawalla beach is a few kms north of Tangalle.   We were there on New Year's Eve and shared this wide expanse of beach with around 4 other people.   It is lined with palm trees and a few fishing boats.  If you are looking for the experience of wide, sandy and empty beaches - try here.  (You should note that the beach is sort of in two parts - you can usually walk around the rocky headland to reach the longer, more beautiful bit but in our case, the river running through was too high so we had to take a tuk tuk.)
In the lagoon there are several big and gorgeous varans You can freely watch. Overally, the laggon provides a very nice and peaceful view. It is also a good place for canoying.

As we've read a lot about Tangalle Lagoon we took a scooter from Tallala and went for it, which is more known between locals as Rekawa. It is rather hard to find the right place to hire a boat, so when we met some local fishermen it felt like a victory))) For 1000 rupees and 3 cigarettes they made a small trip on traditional boat around lagoon. We have met several birds which can be met all over the island, so actually it was not that interesting. Maybe better to go on sunrise when nature is more active.
quite a few opportunities to see birds and water monitors and monkeys in the trees. Most places in Asia the monkeys are city dwelling beggars. We love the green outdoors of the wild.
We loved kayaking on the lagoon, it's so peaceful, we saw local life on the water and so many beautiful birds. A great way to start the day!

We met a fisherman on the beach who offered us a tour on the lagoon. We deciden to give it a try and it was one of the best activity we could do!!! At 6:30 am we met him and he took us with his boat ( tradicional one in Sri Lanka ) around the lagoon. We were completely alone during the 1:30 hour trip and saw many diferent tipes of birds and varanus!!! We strongly recommend this activity!! If you want to contact the fisherman go to the Princess Lagoon, close to the ibis guest house at the end of Medaketiya beach.

Nice kayaking experience. Water monitors, monkeys, snakes, birds. Good for nature lovers and photography. We were given map plan of the mangrove kayaking trip for one and half hours to hang on the neck.

Fun experience kayaking on the lagoon however paddling upstream was quite difficult (quite a strong current for amateurs). Not clear which areas are safe to kayak in- we encountered some extremely shallow areas (30cm or less!!) in which we could have got stuck. No clear route. We saw quite a few unidentified reptiles which looked like large lizards/snakes/crocs!!!! Quite scary when you are the only people on the lagoon.
At this time of year, strong arms are needed for the paddle up, but then of course it's a breeze coming back. Great for taking kids out to find wildlife.

We compared experiences with other travellers and it sounded like we saw a lot more in the morning. It's so beautiful you may even want to again in the evening. Mallika's eldest son has eyes like a hawk, I would recommend going with him.

We spent about 3 hours in a kayak (by ourselves) and all of us enjoyed a lot. So many birds, the sounds surround us were so peaceful... A mixture of peace and adventure at same time. We really enjoy the lagoon.
Very close to cabanas, maybe 3 minutes walk..allowes you to explore and observe the wild life..birds, monkeys etc :D while canoeying..
A long walk between the lagoon and rekawa beach was rewarded by sighting of a troop of monkeys a water monitor and lots of birds. Great to gaze at from our room at Buckingham place.
Went kayaking in the lagoon, get price and a fun morning out. Give you a cute map so you can follow different routes
The lagoon is inland behind the stretch of land where Good Karma Villas are. Has lots of birds and other animals. Basically it is a pretty little area.

Pradeep is an unassuming young man and passionate about protecting the environment. He engages with the local fishermen in order to educate them about not dumping rubbish in the lagoon and with his own funds organises quarterly clean ups. He has a number of double and single sit on top canoes which can be hired by the hour or half day or full day. Smart and cleAn life jackets are provided,together with a dry sack and map of the lagoon. We so enjoyed paddling through the mangroves that we went out again, very early morning to watch the birds and monitors and gentle languors. It was incredibly peaceful and no rubbish anywhere. If you visit Tangalle this is a must activity. Walk towards the end of the beach and you will see the canoes on the banks of the lagoon. This was one of our Tangalle highlights.

we were out in a kayak around 8:30am in November, and the place was so quiet. we floated near the mangroves, we watched bunches of little silvery fish skipping over the top of the water, and water buffalo walking alongside the lagoon. a very memorable morning in Tangalle, highly recommended!

At the end of our stay we had a trip to the lagoon. We enjoyed it a lot. The boat was very authentic, guide was nice and showed us nice places and many birds etc. we saw sea eagels for example and many other...

Totally unexpected on my trip to Tangalla. I rented a bike and wandered around the area and found this lagoon. Some guesthouses rent kayak or part of a tour (I rented) and then took me about 3 hours just exploring and snapping photos of birds. I was a bit careful though for some parts of the lagoon are "private" as one guy pointed out. Still it was good for a break from the beach.

This fishing trip was organised by the Turtle Bay hotel with a local fisherman, he was lovely and even brought us some fruit and homemade snacks his wife had made. Our children caught fish and giant prawns and helped throw the nets in, it was a lovely experience.
Very tranquil surroundings lots of birds & water monitors. mangroves are stunning & great in the morning or afternoon
We had a lot of fun during our kayak tour on the langoon! You should check this out when you are around
Many different varieties of bird life and great for the kids with the kayaks. There are water monitors and monkeys, a miniature amazon !!
Lagoon 1 Km away in Tangalle town area. main road is working distance. it is birds pradise lot of birds in that area also many nest, lovely scenery with sunset. Highly recommended.
An amazing place. You will be surrounded by wild nature, beautiful birds, stunning views and lots of more beautiful things. Highly recommended.

Staying next to the lagoon&becoming restless spending all our time on the beach, we decided to take up the recommendation of kayaking. No more than 2 minutes from our hotel (Harmony Beach Bungalows) we walked to the lagoon&kayaked our way round. The waters are very shallow&you are guaranteed to get a little wet. Watch out for the water monitors&the jumping fish - we were even lucky enough to see a monkey jumping through the trees. At 500 rupees for an hour it was well worth it.
we stayed in lagoon paradise hotel on the beach and discovered the amazing walk behind the hotel. beautiful nature walk with farms and little bridges to wander in.

Went there on a kayak around an hour up and down, amazing lagoon. Lots and lots of birds, saw a few sea eagle too. Not sure when was the last time I see them. Lovely scenery, a must thing to do if you visit Tagalle.
around two miles from end to end surrounded by mangrove trees , ideal for casual exploring , no crocodiles , Storks , monkeys , water monitors , many type4s o0f bird
Birds, big and small, ncl king fisher, varans and the fantastic trees. Book the tour with Patini Bungalows or Ibis
You can have a kajak for a nice tour on the lagoon (early morning or afternoon), you will see lots of birds, warans,...
A scenic view which is ideal to watch sun rise and sun set.

Taking a boat trip on the lagune just before sunset gave a fantastic experience of seeting the herons and cormorants returning to their night rests. Just before dark hundreds of fruit eating bats travel across the lagune, an incredibel sensation in the twilight! The little restaurant at the landing offers large cold beers!
very beautiful and almost deserted beach with quite a few restaurant and hotels close by. On the down side the waves made it hard to swim and there were no good snorkeling close by.
The wildlife especially near dawn and dusk is worth looking at - look out for the water monitors that always impress and of course the birds. Mosquito repellant a must.
Good birding near the hotel. People left me/us alone most of the time some 'followers' were just curious I guess...

went looking for the lagoon on bikes. found a road near the nature resort hotel with access to the lagoon but no boats (there had been a tourist murder at the resort and the whole place was very subdued). the beach cabanas place nearby had kayaks but no-one came to see us so we gave up.  Looks nice the lagoon but in places there is the usual plastic food wrapping rubbish dumped.

go to the lagoon, it's a very nice experience. We did it twice, at sunset and at dawn. We took a kayak from our hotel (the mangrove cabanas). A lot of birds, a lot of different animals, beautiful view, fishermen. The lagoon is very big and has some small island at then of it. The suggestion is to go.
Tangalle is very nice area, but please keep in the mind the sea (waves) is normally very rough i.e. when travelling with kids I suggest you select a hotel with a pool if you like swimming

The Nature Tangalle Resort had canoe's to rent so we took them out for a leisurely row on the lagoon. With rich wildlife on the banks it was a great way to spend an afternoon. Ask the locals to direct you to the bird nesting grounds for great photo opportunities.
It's very nice expirience even for my 60yo aunt. Don't miss it.
Looks pretty at first glance but is full of rubbish. Don;t swim here.

You can visit the Tangalle Lagoon with Karu's cathamaran from the Ibis Guesthouse, where they take also the reservations ([--]). The cathamaran is a traditional boat like the ones the fishermen use in the Tangalle area. Unfortunately many of them got lost due of the tsunami. You will see wunderfull cypress landscapes and many, many birds. If you have good luck you also will meet warans which have their nests in the lagoon. The lagoon is a natural reserve. We recommend this wunderfull tour to all visitors of Tangalle. pore
